Under his alias Lil Slayyy, the newest Orioles Draft pick has a different skill-set off the field. Tito 2K! Top moments in Francona's 2,000-win (and counting) career To mark the occasion of Terry Francona becoming just the 13th manager with 2,000 wins, let's¬†take a look at some of the best (and funniest) moments of a¬†Hall of Fame-worthy 24-year career. Ohtani making The Sho his Byron Buxton enjoying an All-Star '25 PCA having a season for the ages All rise for the clutch Judge Welcome to Juan Soto summer Salvy still making a splash for KC The grass is always Greene(r) in Detroit Electric Elly bringing the smiles to Cincy Another day, another Randy home run carousel-arrow-right-3 They say nobody's perfect. Try telling that to to this Pirates affiliate On July 4, the Greensboro Grasshoppers -- the High-A affiliate for the Pirates -- threw a combined perfect game, something that doesn't happen every day. But what if it happens ... every nine days? Pirates Follow Grasshoppers Follow The latest quiz from Sporcle and MLB Think you're a baseball expert? Take one of our quizzes and prove it Help pick the All-Star Game MVP Make your voice heard starting in the 6th inning of Tuesday's Midsummer Classic, when you can start casting your ballot for the 2025 Chevrolet All-Star Game MVP. Surprise picks, famous families headline Day 1 of Draft The first two picks of the Draft defied nearly every mock, but fittingly Ethan Holliday went to Colorado, where his father Matt starred for years. Plus, the Red Sox reeled off their 10th win a row and Kyle Stowers hit THREE homers off his former club. He's an All-Star now -- and the team that traded him knows why Traded last year by the Orioles, Kyle Stowers returned to Baltimore this past weekend as a newly minted All-Star. And just for good measure, the Marlins slugger went OFF on Sunday with 3 homers among his 5 hits, plus 6 RBIs. Marlins Follow K. Stowers Follow Prospects Meet the 2025 Top 10 Draft picks! Best storylines from the '25 MLB Draft Best on-field swag from the All-Star Futures Game Prospect Team of the Week: June 30-July 6 Top 10 Prospects All-Star Futures Game rosters The homers keep coming for KC's Carter Jensen Owen Caissie becoming a mash machine Prospect Team of the Week: June 23-29 McGonigle another Tiger on rise carousel-arrow-right-4 Here's one jersey you don't want to get dirty We know Pope Leo XIV was at Game 1 of the 2005 World Series and he was no doubt going crazy when Paul Konerko hit a clutch grand slam in Game 2. Twenty years later, the White Sox-loving pontiff had a gift for the other No. 14. White Sox Follow P. Konerko Follow Dodgers prospect slugs his way to Futures Game MVP honors Josue De Paula's three-run homer in the fourth inning erased the AL‚Äôs two-run lead and catapulted the NL to victory, securing the Larry Doby Most Valuable Player Award for the Dodgers' No. 1 prospect in the All-Star Futures Game. J. De Paula Follow Quartet of Japanese pitchers make Major League history Four Japanese-born pitchers got the start Saturday: Shinnosuke Ogasawara (Nationals), Shohei Ohtani (Dodgers), Yusei Kikuchi (Angels) and Yu Darvish (Padres). Pretty cool, right? It's also never happened before. S. Ohtani Follow Y. Darvish Follow S. Ogasawara Follow Y. Kikuchi Follow ICYMI Longest homers of 2025 HR robberies that leave everyone speechless Have no fear, walk-off season is here! Best moments of free baseball It's a ... üçº carousel-arrow-right-5 500-foot homers are incredible. But how about a 500-mile HR? Monday's T-Mobile Home Run Derby will bring out MLB's top sluggers. But none of them will come close to the longest homer in Atlanta history from way back in 1954. No high schooler has ever thrown harder, or had a cooler name Left-handed Draft prospect Jack Bauer (that's right, he was named after the iconic terrorist-thwarting character from "24") has been soaring up boards because of his eye-popping velocity. J. Bauer Follow A second career at age 34, this time on the mound Tyler Naquin was drafted by Cleveland thirteen years ago as an outfielder and had some memorable moments with the team. Now he's back in the organization as a relief pitcher ... and he's getting outs! T. Naquin Follow Guardians Follow Captains Follow Load More...
